name: Market Place Restaurant Cocktail
address: 355 Food Center Dr, Bronx, NY 10474, USA

reviews.text: Simple, clean, and delicious food.
Come as you are
Great service, tasty food, reasonable prices, conveniently located - greasy spoon greatness!!
For what it is. This is a nice spot to hit if you need it. Quality wasn‚Äôt all great but the availability is there. The owner was very polite and service was prompt.
EXPENSIVE FOR NOTHING. Cash only. ATM FEE..I would stay away. Coffee refill is not free..

Place has a unpleasant odor  and  small cup of coffee is too expensive This place is a joke.
Great place to eat Jimmy is super great conversationist
Their ATM limit is $100 max. Withdraw fee is $3. Most drivers take out $250 at a time to pay for lumper fee. Its theft.

Asked for the cheesy peezy double and it was delicious! Jimmy hooked me up with that special combo and oh my god it was delish!! The hospitality here is great and I feel so welcomed by the staff :) Shout out to George for being a great sport
This is only reason I come to Hunts Point! Good food!

Food was delicious very friendly staff I would eat there again

I drive a semi, and found my way to this place several years ago to get a bite, a guy behind the counter was screaming at another guy who walked in because he owed him money and when he said he couldn't pay, the guy yelling offered to buy him something to eat! New York, forget about it! People speaking all kinds of languages, yet understood each other. Like stepping into the middle of a disfunctional family reunion. Loved it. Food was great. Thanks.
Is a very  nice place  manager at Plymouth  is very nice person  very friendly  and they are average  to get u unloading.  And very convenient  wash out  35$ cash only .I like tha place

Great atmosphere.  The owner makes you feel like you are family. The food is great.
Good food when hungry. Only take cash but there is a on site atm (works when it wants to tho)
A knock off version of Dennys with good old American cookin....Bronx style. Ask for Jimmy he is the man...
